snippet: Buyers of the iPhone 5 have turned to Mapion, a map application for smartphones produced by a Japanese company.
abstract: Apple iPhone 5 map errors have prompted legions of Japanese users to flock to other map services, including homegrown company Mapion; downloads of its new iPhone app have jumped threefold in the previous week.

headline.main: Apple Maps Errors Send Japanese to Homegrown App
headline.print_headline: Apple Maps Errors Send Japanese to Homegrown App

snippet: Analysts say the nation’s workers have become more aware of their rights but have few outlets to challenge or negotiate with employers.
abstract: Riot at a Foxconn Technology factory in Taiyuan, China, underscores labor tension in the country; analysts say worker unrest has grown more common because workers are more aware of their rights, and yet have few outlets to challenge or negotiate with their employers; Foxconn is important electronics supplier to firms like Apple.

headline.main: Riot at Foxconn Factory Underscores Rift in China
headline.print_headline: Factory Riot Underscores Rift in China

byline.original: By DAVID BARBOZA and KEITH BRADSHER

snippet: Reports on social media sites in China dispute what FoxConn Technology company officials said led to a riot at one of its manufacturing facilities that involved up to 2,000 employees.
abstract: Reports on social media sites in China dispute what FoxConn Technology company officials said led to a riot at one of its manufacturing facilities that involved up to 2,000 employees.

headline.main: Chinese Social Media Accounts Clash With Official Reports on Riot at Foxconn Factory

snippet: I’m not much of a talker on flights. I figure people want to be left alone. But on one recent flight my seatmate was a girl about 6 years old; she was charming, but talked nonstop.
abstract: Frequent Flier column features television producer Jeff Collins discussing his flying experiences.

headline.main: A Naughty Word, and a Scolding From a Seatmate
headline.print_headline: A Naughty Word, and a Scolding From a Seatmate

snippet: The recent multibillion-dollar patent purchases by Apple and Google, though exceptional, were possible because of a broader trend: patents have become a new asset class.
abstract: The recent multibillion-dollar patent purchases by Apple and Google, though exceptional, were possible because of a broader trend: patents have become a new asset class.

headline.main: With Smartphone Deals, Patents Become a New Asset Class
headline.print_headline: With Smartphone Deals, Patents Become a New Asset Class

snippet: First-weekend sales of the iPhone 5 beat those of its predecessor, the iPhone 4S, by about one million, but still missed some analysts’ forecasts.
abstract: First-weekend sales of the iPhone 5 beat those of its predecessor, the iPhone 4S, by about one million, but still missed some analysts’ forecasts.

headline.main: Apple Sells Five Million New iPhones

snippet: "A cable eclipse of the networks," the power consumption of data centers, and what the expansion of Verizon's spectrum means for cable companies.

snippet: The markets posted modest losses after a report on the German economy said it had fallen for the fifth consecutive month.

snippet: A spokesman said a fight among employees on Sunday night turned into a riot that had to be broken up by thousands of police officers.
